results.title: Reproductive system. - 2nd. ed.
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Media and Instant Miracles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Part of a series which comprehensively covers the major systems of the body. This episode examines the functions of the reproductive system in the male and female. Diagrammatic animation illustrates how pituitary hormones control and the maturation and functioning of the organs and how they in turn make reproduction possible through the union of egg and sperm.

results.title: Reproductive system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Uses animation and photomicrography to present a description of the human reproductive system. Shows similarities and differences between male and female reproductive organs, locates them in the body and describes the specific functions of each in the creation of life. No other credits available.

results.title: Muscular system [b&w]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
This film looks at the three types of muscle in the human musculature system. The structure of the muscle, the nerve impulse and the chemical process of muscular movement are explained.

results.title: Excretory system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Part of a series which comprehensively covers the nine major systems of the body. This episode examines the functions of the excretory system. Diagrammatic animation clarifiers the role of the blood as transporters of wastes away from the cells and the work of the lungs, kidneys and skin as they remove carbon dioxide, water and heat, salts and nitrogen compounds.

results.title: Circulatory System [B&W]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Animation, cinefluorography, drawings, and close-ups of live organs are used in analysing the entire circulatory system. Explains in detail the functions of the heart, lungs, and kidneys; follows the flow of blood through all parts of the body; and explains the role of the circulatory system in maintaining good health.

group_works.title: How to prepare your home for sale
group_works.creator_credit: Tim Counihan, Sarah Tringas and Moviemaster

results.title: The Chemistry of digestion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
Nutrient molecules in food are too large to be absorbed into the body. Through the chemical processes of digestion, these nutrients are split into small, component molecules that can be absorbed. Animation, X-ray footage and laboratory demonstrations illustrate the major steps in the digestion of carbohydrates, fats and proteins.

results.title: On the nose
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
An introduction to the sense of smell. Animation is used to illustrate the operations of the smell receptors in the nasal cavities and how this information is processed by the brain. Clearly defines the concept of smelling and recognition of odours.

results.title: Matter of taste
results.creator_credit: David H. Gluck, Naomi Robin, James B. Maas, James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
Looks at the important role played by taste in the human body. Investigates the chemical reactions in papillae and how information is obtained and relayed to the brain and the taste identified as sweet, sour,salty or bitter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David H. Gluck, Naomi Robin, James B. Maas, James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society
